page.title: 08FOOTBALL ANCIENT AND MODERN
page.content: Chester-le-Street's soccer team has its home ground at Chester Moor on the southern outskirts.Improvements to the ground since 1975 include a 200 seater Grandstand accomodating most of the average crowd of 220,some covered terracing and new floodlights for 1985 -86.Also,23 Junior School teams compete for the league and cup,the C.B. Watson and the R.O.Willis trophies. Football is still popular,although the customary Shrove Tuesday match involving hundreds of people ended in 1932 following claims of damage to property and lost business by traders. The game started outside the Lambton Arms hotel and lasted over 4 hours.The aim was to reach one end of the of the street but,since it slopes down to Con Burn,the ball usually ended up there.
